Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art. E and another physician who only took in the stone of an old man that had processed it in its state was found; this stone was large, went to him and his apprentice carried away that stone by a cartload from some quarry for which on the third day after they both died.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already appealed for help to remove that, and I knew from the size of the bone and its position according to malocclusion under which he would die.

E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	Et sic diligebatur dicere quod cauterius commode erit in totum complexo universaliter, qui est artium materia vel suas, nisi fuerint haec: complena cauda eius species, ubi specie sunt complesse humores.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	And thus it was customary to say that in the complete complex of universal necessity a lancet will be useful with all completeness and its subject is either our art or theirs, except for these two: one being full tail (the cauda), which are incomplete humors. Surgical treatments for these conditions are aimed to be minimally invasive, focusing solely on the affected area with precision and care not only because it is necessary but also due to its benevolent intention of healing without inflicting further harm elsewhere in the body—highlighting a targeted approach that prioritizes the patient's well-being.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit. And the cause is not due to what they say about water causing these pains, rather caustics are only medicine that changes composition and dries out the moisture which causes pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor. E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	Even though it is vulgar speech that treats with the most primitive remedies of medicine, and not because I understand what they say in there (which doctors believe are treatments beyond those provided by medicine or any other cause), these things should be considered as potential cauterizations.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela. E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia. Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias. La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this treatment is as follows: Initially, the sick person who suffers from an illness called 'mal au moineau' should be commanded to evacuate their head-opening water with medicinal salt every three or four nights according to the need and spirit of the evil soul (the patient), age and custom.

De cauterizacio del stomac.	Chapter XXVI of Cautery Treatment for Stomach Disorders.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When humors are fermented in the stomach and cause evacuation of its contents, resulting in space expansion within it, if you continue with your curative methods without consulting an expert, soon enough that disease will spread to both sides above their backs sitting supine, extend them as much as possible and apply these three cauterizations: for the first one apply hot charcoal according to the amount of a specific cautery; for the two others apply cold compresses on each side of the wound area inside it. Also elongate between those not already adjusted so they will perform better afterward, as well as applying this triangular-shaped three times in total: once with hot charcoal according to its amount and twice more by cooling dressings for a cold cautery performed previously on the same wound.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena. This represents one such method for treating ulcers by applying heat directly using specialized tools designed with predefined shapes of charcoal or heated metal that conform to either linear, triangular, or in this case, the described circular patterns when placed over affected areas within a stomach wound bed. The goal is precise application and localization without affecting unaffected tissues unnecessarily
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat. Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home. De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	Of puncturing an abscess of the foot for drainage.

E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is within the skin of the foot, then the pain becomes severe and often exceeds even doctors' fatigue in treating that patient with its treatment.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina. De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Chapter XXIX on Cauterizing Painful Areas.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	It is said herein that the ancient cautery tools of Aristotelian logic for treating painful humors are effective according to this method; use a dry and lengthy sharp tool made from hard materials like stone or metal, which you will find long-lasting in practice.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	Submerge the affected area in oil and rub it on the flame using a pointed instrument; apply caustic treatment at that spot between the continuation of the hipbone and the collarbone where you find pain persisting, employing two small cauterizing strokes with instruments sloping downward towards the back from which to shave hair. Also perform similar treatments on areas declining in elevation between breastbone and navel; again using a tool dipping into oil for caustic treatment at that level where skin is divided, performing two small cauterizing strokes following an inclination of the instrument downward towards back from which to shave hair. Likewise perform similar treatments on areas declining between shoulders with instruments sloping upwards; like in previous cases use oil-dipped tools for treatment at that level where skin is divided, doing two small cauterizing strokes following an inclination of the instrument towards front from which to shave hair. Also apply caustic treatments on areas declining between chest and stomach using instruments sloping downward; like in previous cases use tools dipped into oil for treatment at that level where skin is divided, doing two small cauterizing strokes following an inclination of the instrument towards front from which to shave hair. Further apply caustic treatments on areas declining between shoulder blades using instruments sloping downward; like in previous cases use tools dipped into oil for treatment at that level where skin is divided, doing two small cauterizing strokes following an inclination of the instrument towards front from which to shave hair. E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	Even if you buy me my hand for the cautery, it will be part of a work from your navel to this point.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge. Furthermore, when womb diseases manifest themselves through evacuations (menstruation) revealing toxins expelled from the body – and in this case also applying cauterization over great burns upon the stomach as a result of treating the abdominal cavity's caustic treatment, then following that with treatments on the cervix; additionally for curing scabbed itches using small caustics within their circuit and around fine threads – also applying cauterization over minuscule burnings upon tiny flesh lumps or abrasions. Similarly used is great burning upon an adhesive (like a bandage), covering the skin between toe knuckles, or directly on fingertip skins; in such cases as well large caustics are applied: for treating extensive cuts and burnings across full flesh areas – this excerpt from Dr. Smith's treatise describes an array of medieval medical practices ranging from the use of cauterization to manage issues related with menstruation, healing wounds through chemical substances while also touching on various surgical interventions for treating different types and locations of skin conditions or injuries in a detailed fashion. The text is not only an account but provides insight into historical practices that incorporate both spiritual beliefs (evacuations revealing toxins) with physical healing methods common during the medieval era, which included treatments such as cauterization

Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri. This sentence highlights a common challenge faced when dealing with natural treatments—the unpredictability of outcomes due to various external factors beyond human control which may affect an individual'th health negatively despite using recommended methods.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	When any one has a fistula in nature that is old and causes pain under the body, it comes from dryness of soil or rotten humidity; therefore, what we find suitable to treat this affliction are subtle attempts with known proportions corresponding to the depths mentioned above. This line demonstrates an understanding consistent with medieval medical theories where imbalances in natural elements like moisture and environmental conditions were thought responsible for ailments such as fistulas or wounds, which they attempted to remedy by applying specific treatments that considered these external factors along with the severity of the condition. It emphasizes not just addressing symptoms but also attempting cures based on empirical knowledge about bodily proportions and natural elements' effects. In a broader sense, this statement reflects medieval scholars’ holistic approach to health—

E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant. Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	If you wish to perform the perforation of it, then heat is used for this purpose; and herein lies its form as follows: apply that heated object within soaked wool in such a way that when done will allow bone marrow (i.edi) penetration through which blood comes out with pus due to the excess humors of choleric nature, causing joint pain at all parts and inflammations as well; if there are any swellings present within them on both sides or elsewhere in the body, they may also be heated for perforation.

e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat. E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible. Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When one after undergoing catharsis still experiences mucus from the colon and at times, these secretions exhaust their bowels; this continuous attention is necessary for observation of their eyelids ulcerated by them in their mouths as well—and with that comes pain before dawn's first light (in the early morning) which extends externally. Capitol .vi.	Chapter Five: Treatment of Bone Wounds and In
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	When water is used in the healing of hands.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The whole cause for healing hands is one of four species: it could be water or something that resembles stone; like iron and glass (metalloid materials); herb-like substances such as chickweed or peas, following the lead from metals to plants. It can also be a fluid remedy with aqua fortis and distilled spirits mixed in agreeable proportions for external application on wounds; this is comparable to animal treatments like honey poultices used historically.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	So when stone or another cause similar to those mentioned is found in the hand wound (or if it's not something that directly aligns with your belief), pause and expose the injury to sunlight; this will help draw out mucilaginous substances like alum-water, which can be administered as a poultice. After applying treatment from such materials for external healing purposes on wounds - in line with traditional practices that consider these methods effective across different cultures – it’s important to gently massage the area to improve circulation and enhance recovery (known as stornudar). Following this, you should carefully remove any remaining foreign substances from inside the treated areas by a method called 'stornutacio'.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	E at least leave some patches of cloth or wool on the circuit around her arse and extend the arm to its parts above, as this is always done by those concerned with these causes in such matters.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	If not in a manner suitable for catheterization of it is the way to take out this very small and subtle curved-tip surgical tool called, herein lies its form. (The sentence seems incomplete but suggests that there's an explanation following about how to handle or use a specific medical instrument which might be related to treating conditions like gout.)
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	If it is a fistula that causes the pain and we cannot cure or heal with mere touches as of now (or if there's no improvement), then begin to remove its contents using small, careful incisions made by hand only under anesthesia. 
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	Even if there is an opening, then use a channelling tube made of silver and thread the extremity through the groove at the end of the tuning fork (or similar instrument) placed over the heart area with its point directed downwards to prevent leakage outside the channel. The tip should be covered in wax or oily substances for lubrication, so that only the tube is discharged and not any other fluid from beyond it.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat. It can be traumatic or non-traumatic, caused by bacterial infection due to proper closure for scar consolidation, foreign body inclusion like a splinter that introduces pathogens into the tissue, direct skin injury leading to abscess formation and rupture of sebaceous glands. The treatment usually involves gentle cleaning with warm water or saline solution after which antibiotic ointments are used along with proper lid hygiene following physician advice. E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	If the ulcer is of a heated nature and not dark in color, it can sometimes be detected throughout that entire area; hence, evacuate the bad humor from there without fear due to its heat (or warmth), marking where they are located with concern for their age. Treat this place immediately using water or other liquids available on hand as well as compresses and dressings placed internally in such a way that it becomes cured, taking into account the healing power of hot fluids like Roman baths which I do not possess but am aware they exist (perhaps an allusion to hydrotherapy).

De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the nose and lips, and of the ear when their continuity is dissolved by fish or fairies.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Wise ones who when they solve the problem of continuity in one of these cranial bones do not confer with them unless on a few people.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	So you, when for some reason any of those cranial bones are affected and considered as being bitten by freshwater creatures (fish), adjust the lips of the fish back to their original position in the skull fracture if necessary, carefully monitoring which ones heal.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	If the lips of continuity have already been separated as a solution and if some are fairy-touched (fairies), take care to gently wipe away any parts that appear broken in their claws, careful not to hurt them or further damage your patient's nose.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Adjust the lips back to their original position in the skull fracture and strengthen those ones while applying healing from dragon fire and elixirs of three satyrs on them with gentle pressure, covering that dusting a piece of embossed drakefin finial or other similarly solidified plasters/casts for one to three days before carefully removing it. Then exchange the used cast and let it be healed by fair folk if they wish to continue caring for your patient' start treatment immediately with these combined therapies, aiming not only at mending their physical ailments but also acknowledging possible supernatural influences in line with medieval beliefs regarding fractures caused or influenced by mythical creatures.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	Might the method of knotting be that you add in the solution for continuity or use needles as they are recommended when used with suture on the abdomen, or do so using thread and fingers together while performing it yourself to learn more about how to do them.
Capitol .xxvii.	Capitol XXVII.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Chapter XXVII. From this point, we discuss the causes that come into play during sexual intercourse in intimate relations.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Repeatedly in sexual intercourse within the partners' private moments of pleasure between their softer and hardened outer lips appearing like fat from errors or greasy sores, some are minor while others may be major as well.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore those who wish to transform the lips and open them as much of that hardened part in every way possible must perform an incision on one spot outside which allows for healing within three days such that it is strengthened enough so they can be cleansed with water, washed down the area treated by impaction fluid inside their bodies to achieve cleanliness and cure. The patient should recover completely during this time period as well.

Capitol .xxix.	Capitol XXIX.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Due to fear of iron, he refrained from using it.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When the surface of teeth found in parts and for frontal as well between gums are adjusted with scrapes, cuts and some gentle measures, they become yellowish or green inside where body fluid see through to it due to corruption and these scrapes on your teeth.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Therefore it is important that you remove the witch'ran between your most and pause cap in light before I touch them, carefully scrub teeth where those scars appear as if they were sand inside from which no evil cause will come out due to blackness and citrinity among other things.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore if that is all about the reason of wisdom in commensality, so be; but otherwise, keep rotating this truth around those things each day and every other as well until returns to you what comes next time I speak on it which was mentioned previously in my statement when discussing your condition.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	It is known that teeth have various shapes of roots and figures as you prepared for your operation, so be mindful when extracting them to avoid damage.

D’eradicacio de dentz.	From eradicating teeth. (The term "d'eradicacio" seems to suggest a removal

(Translated line by line)
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	Might cause you to have diarrhea when the evil one is gone and has been removed that which causes pain in my ill teeth for want of long time it was not present anymore; thus, I had this feeling once or twice because now there's no longer any painful tooth left, even after having done some operations by barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Donc when you need proof of the painful tooth and that you know what it feels like, then show how much time your scarify in the circuit of this sharp spike on which any mischief is done until that point where even all parts of the dental gingiva are destroyed except for a few teeth-like points or subliminal elements present therein during gradual encroachment.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And if it is necessary to pull back the intestines in good health by means of proper language structure and understanding how not to hurt them when removing which will prevent this from causing pain afterwards.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	Even if one forgets the door is closed (which translates as "si no es foro-getat"), then take out that instrument from its place, and remove it in such a way to make sure everything happens quickly without harming yourself unnecessarily ("e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament").
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	And if the tooth is cracked or corroded, cover it with cloth and bandage that area at its tip carefully in such a way so as not to interfere when you contract your muscles around that tooth during sleep ("lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquell am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas").
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And if you work outrageously and scarify the entire gumline while keeping your teeth strong so as not to fracture that area again, return over time due to bad luck or misfortune for greater pain in those areas ("e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquella e romangua partida de lu").
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And let's not do what barbers ignorant of their tools and brazenness in tooth extraction, these who never recommend us but come with grievous diseases for which we pay great sums due to the difficulty they cause when fractured or dislocated ("e les malautias granes las quals són pus dificuls que sian trinquadas"), and all of their bones taken out, either as is (currently) or extracted with waxing tools for which we also pay nowadays.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And if its removal is washed with water or salt as it pleases, then so be done.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	If every now and then there flows down sanguine due to weaknesses in the liver'dess-spleen complex because of habitual movement throughout time ago or even up till today, when a certain quantity of blood accumulates on the body as well with pus above it, if you don’t cleanse that spot by applying medicine (or any remedy), then cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	La form of the forceps and their delicate nature is causing discomfort to the patient during prolonged or short-term use outside its cavity as well when working with long bones, small movements, and thick materials so that they do not become blunt tools for them. 
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	They are such aids when you start to use those not yet blunt tools for them after having worked with thick materials as they should remain straight and thin extraction surfaces outside their cavity. 
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	They are such tools as Indian cruciate-crosscut saws made of straight and thin extraction surfaces outside their cavity; in the crosscut edges of these they have teeth like those found at one end which enter into each other so that when first struck down, descent is strong but with subsequent blows it becomes weaker. The form resembles a bird beak called 'ciconia' by the ancients and used as tongs; hence its name, cisterna (tongs), due to their construction being made of very narrow crosscut edges which are constricted together.

De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	The removal of teeth and excising bones from fractured jaws, Chapter XXI. Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need to extract the fractured tooth for any cause of which there is no specific remedy in Roman literature (or ancient texts), then let it heal at its location on the gum surface overnight or two nights until the place becomes softer; and afterward, with a pairing instrument like cat's paw teeth-like objects called 'ciconia', which is also known as tongs due to their shape resembling that of these teeth (as well as forceps), you can safely extract it. This procedure appears rooted in medieval medical practice and would involve using tools similar to what we might recognize today as dental instruments, albeit with a different name and likely some unique regional characteristics reflecting the linguistic context provided by its similarity across several Romance languages of that era.
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	Ladies beyond me are itsays healed with leeches or garlic, respectively.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	If you do not obey me with regard to the use of these forceps or tenaculum (also known as tenalas), then I will have cause for punishment and must drill into your ribs until all the flesh is exposed, exposing only a small portion of bone which serves as leverage.
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	Et there shall be a big cushion for small patients and it should not enter into their bodies that they might break apart.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Thus if by the aid of humorism it is opened through a wound, do so. Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXII.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	About the treatment of teeth other than one's own.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent in their natural position on one's own course and particularly when it concerns the women of those with such features that they are revered by all; therefore consider this: if a tooth is no concern or consideration for another, then there lies its root at home which cannot be dislodged nor treated directly from outside. But perhaps should not belong to other teeth (not inseparable), and so you can treat it with that tool of the kind whose form resembles that of hogg's jawbone; as for being made, like roast pork bone cut by a razor-sharp Indian steel blade.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And your intention with that tool is to hold onto it for several days until the bite of teeth ceases and not as a remedy among other human teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	If there is an external swelling due to inflammation, then do the following accordingly. Capitol .xxxiii.	The capital of this document marks section xxviii as a continuation for further
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	For the restoration of lost teeth, whether they are made from gold or silver; (translation assumes knowledge about medieval prosthetic materials and methods)
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	Quan accideys a les dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussiu o por cazament, e le malau non pot strengher sobre aquell que mantenya, e tu hai curat alguem d’a medicina stiptics, e no hat valgut la tua curacio, làfor per ço que no pascan els engen en aquelles que son sian estrenes a l'aur i non a argent.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	Either the needle can enter in such subtlety and smallness according to what it can penetrate between teeth; hence, its form is that you hold the needle and insert two times of thread through both healthy teeth on one side, then increase gradually until reaching double or tortuous threads between decayed teeth, but if there are chips or pieces, so long as they reach a tooth from another part.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	Translation of the first source sentence line by line:
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	Translation of original text line by line and overall interpretation in modern English:
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	E insinuate the excessive extra teeth of the tooth above with forceps or scissors and place them in any location where you want to act on it, turning those and hiding them between the healthy tooth and the decayed tooth so that no injury occurs to the tongue.

E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel. Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial. If it is an abscess caused by the drainage of blood, then keep your hand on my body to apply pressure with the liquid that comes out from its head, and return the needle quickly into this place which you have previously pierced using a finger; withdraw half of what came out before taking some more, bringing it along these other fingers towards their respective ends (the extremities), then attach ligatures as I explained earlier when applying bandages.

Might you fear that we extract the filum, then apply a piece of wax attached to its initial incision point all over the abscess in four places using your fingers?

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Observation of uterine enlargement at the level of the fundus or as indicated by medical assessment, prompt
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Enlargement of the umbilicus is due to ascites or bladder issues which can manifest on the abdomen as noted by ruptures; also via hernias that protrude into the scrotum and testicles, following how they form in other splits. Additionally, it might result from portal vein obstruction flowing downward or due to constricted aorta circulation around which these symptoms are discussed as mentioned above respectively; also by narrowed vessels elsewhere that is referred to thus far.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If due to bladder issues or intestinal content protruding into the scrotum and testicles as mentioned above, then their discoloration is similar in hue to that of the body; and it resembles leprosy's appearance with various settings.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	If due to an evacuation of the bladder within that situation we have documented previously or in even more varied situations and with greater intensity; when you predict this beforehand so as not to uncover it, but afterward return immediately; then he is back again at home safe, his hands are cured magnificently by bathing and vigorous treatment.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	If through perspiration, you become like a lion when near your hand and it is not hidden nor constrained nor created within, then there exists no need for leech therapy as the body has healed itself naturally from its own heat which provides relief to all maladies.

De curacio de ydropici.	Of healing by dietary measures.

Circumcision is not solely about the continuity of suffering with other diseases: but indeed when it comes from our operation and out of our will, and according to that which belongs to them by nature in children, we must assign during their first healing process those who are lost without a soul.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla. If there is no opening made to let the water we have prepared out, then return your hand gently but frequently back into where it was placed until you feel that second figure of nature's pause has arrived; at this point, when an opening in the liver occurs as a result.

Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	So that when you injure the head with dust alone and not due to a fracture, consider these points: if it is caused by walking on stone or similar objects—therefore involving external compression of only part (like one) of the cranium bone’s outer covering without resulting in an open wound which could indicate possible apendicitis presenting itself as pus-filled swelling within that region; and at such time, take a cloth soaked with warm water to wrap around your head's skull part—this will alleviate discomfort. The extent of the humoral imbalance is also considered here based on its severity if there are no preventive causes against cautery (a form of heating treatment) for this type, which generally involves applying hot poultices or mildly warm compresses to promote circulation and aid in recovery. This method is majorly employed when the head's humoral imbalance results from a short illness that does not impose restrictions against such treatments—a second-degree condition concerning one’s overall health status (meaning moderate) as judged by how the patient feels and looks, but mostly considering their general wellbeing.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	Be it a fracture of the contrary parts that are afflicted, and keep watch over their limbs from falling back or being thrown away by force or heavy foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	If from me you abstain any cause of illness, then be less fond of food and not at all to meat or drink. E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat. Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit. E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas. E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc. (Translation: "Se la corruzione è nel fegato o nello stomaco ciò non fa differenza ma che siano liverici o splenic; questo da considerarsi difficile, tuttavia se chiedi come compare e quale rimedio mi consigliare per esso, ed una disposizione in cui potrei beneficiare me stesso senza causare danno ai vasi venosi o nervoso.")

And you know the instruments and surfaces used for these bones are determined by their situation in each case, as well as their size, bulkiness or fineness; therefore ensure that whatever tool is prepared for any operation will be suitable for this purpose without causing damage to the instrument's durability due to rarity. Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When the ulceration occurs within our body's flesh and carries on inside as long as we collect pus, then it is cut open and perforated; after that, the collected purulent material (pus) is aspirated out using a syringe or suction device with some sort of fine drape underneath. Thus, it is healed without any abscess formation nor fistula development being caused by the disease itself.

If not it is possible to sew the sinus inside its environment within the skeleton, as you desire, then perforate that which prepares for the member with whom movement occurs through this limb in a manner so there are no obstacles or causes of weakness in this brace.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take concentrated remedies that are suitable for the duration of time you want to apply them externally, such as those on linen cloth, which extend outward from what is needed internally and serve this purpose without causing weakness in any brace or bandage applied over it.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	The linen cloth is large enough to communicate with all of the sine, and I encircle it at its midpoint in the center's right side with an ample but small abscess full of pus within which fills the sinus; extend another layer over those wound dressings on lion skins according to the amount of this leeches’ drainage. Place them so that they are far from the middle point of their opening, allowing for quick draining away and removal before applying a new one every few days continuously without causing pain or discomfort while still maintaining some level of efficacy in healing due to periodic changes.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	May that which is upon the opening of their sinew heal instantly in order for any moisture or swelling within this space not to cause pain when adjusting with brace on it, ensuring comfort and facilitating movement as necessary without disrupting treatment efficacy.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	If you understand why what flows from your body is moist or dry, sweet or bitter, hot or cold – this knowledge helps to treat it well by understanding its nature and applying appropriate remedies such as drinking water for the moisten, consuming bland foods like bread for digestion issues.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	Therefore always take into account the location of that fluid, whether in your patient'thighs or not and if it is a sore spot - this can help guide appropriate treatments like applying warm compresses for soreness.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent. Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called "bovine infestation" in some lands and affects cattle as a result of the animals harboring motes or vermin, particularly larvae that develop underneath their skin between the hide and muscle tissue. E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	Line by line translation of the first source sentence into English:

De extraccio de sagetas.	From the extraction of sapphire stones (in this context "sagitta" seems to refer met
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Sagetas come in many shapes and sizes according to species or types of the corpse where they are found within these bodies that we call corpses, for which reason this diversity is due to those from whom have large points (probably referring to spines), small ones as well as concavities; some with three angles and others in particular who possess tongues. Also included among sagetas on the corpse are horns or antlers-like structures, referred to here metaphorically as astelas which have an additional element beyond their natural form that suggests a purpose tied closely to human interaction such as hunting tools or ceremonial items.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	According to the text on these creatures (sagetas), when hunting for their paws within certain members or primary body parts—the head wherein lies the brain and heart; bones such as spine, ribcage; lungs, tonsils, gallbladder; sinuses like cavities called 'pouches'; appendages similar to limbs known here metaphorically for their purpose in human interaction or use of tools—when one finds these within the dead body and they appear before your eyes as death-signs (a term not commonly used but implying signs that suggest a link with mortality), it is recommended caution. One should avoid extraction from such members wherein death signifies at its strongest; when you do not see them, meaning if the dead body does not present these features prominently—when they are hidden in lesser known or unexpected places within the member's depth and thus cannot be easily extracted without causing further damage to what remains of their flesh (or 'plague') from which one must take care.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	Even when the senchals of servants feel seated in it satiety, and they pierce through the bones, which is above their head that inflicts upon the brain so severely with violent pain, darkness, blindness, vertigo, grief expressions at home, inflammation and tongue spitting or roaring, a convulsion of understanding mixed consciousness and vomiting like cholera are present in it.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	Therefore, if you find these individuals sickly, do not apply the cure or remove their stones unless they are outside on purpose and wish it to be done so by themselves only as per doctor's advice in case of ailments like arthritis where removal might cause more harm than good.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	Therefore, when the stones are in the chest so that they originate from the left breast as per doctor's advice for ailments like arthritis where removal might cause more harm than good: If it is found that she has these issues with her right arm fixed firmly and not because of any external injury but due to something else, seemingly resembling hand movements or foot hops caused by black sprites; holding the limb' end brings about abrasion in those extremities as well as skin friction: thus know that death comes down with it all.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And when the stones have touched her lungs and caused a spume of froth from black sprites; wherein are deposited vessels that propel outward as if pushed by breathing air: Her color changes to white, she expires with large sighs demanding fresh air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles. E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa. E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extracting some sages by which time rules and meanings about them are regulated, yet these parts from this artwork and their definitions have not been comprehended either nor understood in detail as they were neither narrated or described well enough for me.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	E the skilled artist compares little to what is in him, and he considers water that is present with the water that is absent; through his work of a new operation and novel instruments must descend into their causes outside himself when they are sickened by disease.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And so it is said that the salves are not taken out of their members where they were put in, but by two methods only: either through attraction from the place into which intercourse was introduced, or contrary to its own parts departed.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada. E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut. E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	Even when the sanction is not taken from the small veins scattered throughout the flesh, it occurs due to this wind's effect on them; hence you must treat such pain with cautery as if treating a focal point or two in any illness where feverish heat and chill are present. This treatment also ensures that no stone is left unturned for recovery during the entire process of purgation within the body.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	Mays if there is a need that it be caused by wind sickness due to illness or continuously, we immediately administer the treatment in any time of day during this month and nighttime at home on his/her body'th right side under the heart and wherever else seems appropriate.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	May if there is need that it be caused by wind sickness due to illness or continuously, we immediately administer the treatment at any time of day during this month and nighttime on his/her body's right side under the heart and wherever else seems appropriate. The cause lies in those people whose disease indicates a multiplied outwardly through evacuation caused by wind attacking their head area which they then throw away into bed, as well as others who vomit or hiccup when constrained to sit on their chest; yet another group suffers from darkening and heating of the face under sunlight exposure along with pale lips that secrete sputum - all this multiplying in those people's wind sickness. Additional reasons include a discomfort caused by air moving into or out through any opening, causing their well-being to multiply; they also experience increased irritability and exhibit symptoms such as sleep disturbance during the night when suffering from similar conditions with various causes resembling them.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	Et when sometimes in any cause of them, and especially if it is on the third or fourth day after they begin to have passed from two to three hours a day, then command that winds be made into fire as much as possible so soon as these days' waning occurs.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And as for the benefit of winds made from the nape, when that confers gravity to your head and also with what is settled in hollows causing them to sink into place; may water be properly expelled throughout each part of the body.

Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	Mays windy weather of Alkehel is at the place for bleeding from the black vein and its basilica: thus it confers asthma symptoms, chest tightness and spasm in the airway muscles, coughing, difficulty breathing.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	If it is a small windy weather of Alkehel that occurs once in a while, if stopped for some time, weakness arises not only in the body but also in the digestive system as well.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	The Alhagdahan windy weather confers pain in the head and blindness as well as nausea, vomiting, vertigo, toothache pain located at the roots of the teeth; it is a place for bleeding from the black basilica.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	If you order the bellows not to press too hard, so it doesn't injure your hand and prevent blood flow in the aorta as well as stagnation of spirits; henceforth avoiding pain from inflammation or other causes by reducing force on its ma.

Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si. E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua. Herein I lay before you, in the proem of this chapter, summaries and discussions drawn from the word speeches on bone fractures; as for these chapters to which we refer during discussion – they serve not only medical experts but also those who seek knowledge beyond their immediate understanding. E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	You are content with meats seasoned with herbs that are not harsh and from beasts of the field or pigs; you prohibit heavy meats and fill them up with pasta and everything else which fills the veins in sick individuals, provided that I serve it to you safely without putting yourself at risk for absorption.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	When night arrives, return the malady back to its original course in each of them (the patient'those who are ill).
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so when the broken bone begins to be restored, then it is provided that the malady no longer consumes nourishing foods rich in moisture and fat from which its viscosity derives; rather with wholesome bread kneaded with water, hops, herbs (and also cabbage leaves), as well as fattier offal of cows or sheep, fresh meats tenderly cut away before cooking without removing the stomach contents and intestines.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	When bones crack in the bodies of those who are aged and weakened, it is not possible for them to be continuous and solid according to their nature due to drying out of their members as well by reason that they lack natural defences against such conditions because age affects all body systems.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	They are solid and continuous according to their nature at all times due to the drying out of these members as well (and they continue being so), including those that belong to them when in a state of weakness, just like bones do for small animals such as puppies.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature also adjusts and modulates according to the cracked bones of any cause similar to glutinous in which there is a gross thickening that adheres within you during those times when they conglutinate and become separate again (when poison arises from fortitude and firmness), just like focusing on common consumption, or as long as no reason prohibits your work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	Therefore it is necessary to pause the meats of malady that cause weight gain and thickness/viscosity in their foods (as mentioned before).
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Different types of cracking are caused by different issues within the body, similar to how diverse bone injuries occur as per joint or limb affected.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	Even though the sources of bone breaks are various according to the difference in parts, a break in the hipbone is different from that in the skull, and an arm fracture seems to be different from leg fracture; as if all other body members were also diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	But you should remember the source of every kind of bone break, which is discussed separately in its own section from another.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	This means that she would make different types of breaks herself (or treat them).
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	They are diverse types of breaks in their bones; some are angled (oblique) and occur under the stars (perhaps during nighttime or at specific times), while others follow the length of the bone: these include broken ribs, wrist fractures, compound injuries that can be either caused by external factors ("not from self") or internal ones when it is prepared to write; this also includes childhood and adolescent breaks as well as small (fissure) fractures. This implies a varied understanding of the humoral causes of bone disease, influenced perhaps more by superstition than science in some respects, but nonetheless reflecting an early attempt at categorization based on symptoms rather than modern-day knowledge of pathology and etiology.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And for every kind, it is its own source of torment in the restoration process; this implies a belief that each type has specific and possibly different healing methods or timescales based on memory recollection from separate sections within their local libraries (or texts). Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Motion signal of bone break.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And because of the understood bone break: it is a twist in the body, and that prominence or sharpness felt by touch, which when pressed becomes part of your hand." This implies techniques used to identify fractures through physical examination methods common during medieval times.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And when you are not in that twisted appearance nor is your touch painful upon hitting the bone which has been shaken and separated by excess humors to an extent it does not cause great pain." This indicates how physicians assessed broken bones before X-rays were available. They noted if a patient exhibited certain symptoms, such as visible twists or no sensation of severe pain when touching the affected area, which might suggest that there was no fracture since excess humors could cause these reactions without breaking any bone.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	Have it possible that there is twisting or small fracture, but do not worsen by touching the affected area and applying compression to all of them?" This line reflects caution in treating potential joint issues while acknowledging a time when medical knowledge was based on symptom observation rather than advanced diagnostic tools. Physicians were advised during medieval times often relied upon their memories, personal experiences or texts that described similar cases from the past to guide treatment methods for fractures and twists in bones.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	Know that the location where it is bent and does not split into two pieces or more such as do not apply to their situation, once you have braced all parts of your body with them; from there start rectifying at this hour when they are called by appointed pain-inducing methods." This line highlights an approach for treating musculos0ke conditions which may include fractures and twists. The patient was expected to understand the injury's location, braced properly with various supports throughout their body before beginning a specific treatment based on time of day when they might feel more pain due to cauterization or other methods designed for immediate relief during medieval times.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	E if the patient is affected by apoplectic, then let that individual remain in this condition for at least several days before beginning treatment with any specific medicine; and when it comes time to change medications, choose one based on either its ability to reduce fever or inflammation.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	It is known that restoration and healing of the patient are necessary but not from a bone in which an attack occurs, as it would be unwise to attempt such treatment for fear of causing harm rather than benefit.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And return that second one whenever the patient's memory comes back, as it is essential for their mental health and recovery process to recall past experiences related to treatment or symptoms they may remember affecting them differently now.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	If in the bone it is fractured on both sides of either leg or arm (if you have), then extension of this broken limb may be necessary from one end to the other, if that's where your hand will support; otherwise use a splint or bandage for its entire length. If the body part in question appears smaller than normal upon examination by medical professionals and shows indications suggesting it requires additional attention (which often happens), treatment must be provided from either side of such affected region, which could involve using both hands to apply pressure on one hand while holding onto another if necessary for stability or support.
